      Returns:
      an updateded, filtered DebtView
      Throws:
      UpdatingModelFailed - if the DebtListModel faield to update

    • getEditSelectedDebtView

      public FrameView getEditSelectedDebtView(Debt debt) throws NoItemWasSelected, FulfilledDebtCantChange
      Returns an EditSelectedDebtView frame filled with the selected debt's properties where you can change the selected debt's properties
      Parameters:
      debt - the debt which will be edited
      Returns:
      an EditSelectedDebtView
      Throws:
      NoItemWasSelected - if no item from the lsit was selected
      FulfilledDebtCantChange - if the debt is already filfilled

      Returns:

      Throws:

    • addDebt

      public void addDebt(String name, DebtController.DebtDirection direction, LocalDate date, String amountString, boolean hasDeadline, LocalDate deadline) throws UserNotFound, InvalidAmountException, CreatingRecordFailed
      Creates and saves a new debt with 0 payment.
      Parameters:
      name - the other party's name
      direction - direction of debt
      • I_OWE - user signed in is the debtor, the other party is the creditor
      • THEY_OWE - user signed in is the creditor, the other party is the debtor
      • UNSET - (default) the debt dirextion is not set yet
      date - date of the debt
      amountString - a string representing the amount of the debt
      hasDeadline -
      • true - if the debt has a deadline
      • flase - if the debt has no deadline
        deadline - date of the deadline
        Throws:
        UserNotFound - if no user with the specified name was found
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount was less or equal to 0 or amount could not be parsed to a double value
        CreatingRecordFailed - if an IO Error occured or DebtDirection was UNSET

      • editDebt

        public void editDebt(Debt debt, LocalDate date, String amountString, boolean hasDeadline, LocalDate deadline) throws InvalidAmountException, EditingRecordFailed
        Edits a debt specified in the parameters.

        Only the date, the amount and the deadline can be changed, because changeing the direction would impact others cashflows too.

        Parameters:
        debt - debt that will be edited
        date - the new date value
        amountString - a string representing the new value
        hasDeadline - true if debt should have a deadline, false if not
        deadline - the new value of the deadline
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException -
        • if the amount can't be parsed to a double value
        • if the amount is 0 or less
        • if the amount is less than what's already payed
        EditingRecordFailed - if editing the debt failed due to an IO Error

      • deleteDebt

        public void deleteDebt(Debt debt) throws DeletingRecordFailed, NoItemWasSelected
        Removes a debt from the save files
        Parameters:
        debt - the debt that needs to be removed
        Throws:
        DeletingRecordFailed - if the debt was not deleted due to an IO Error.
        NoItemWasSelected - if no debt was selected

      • payDebt

        public void payDebt(Debt debt, String amountString, LocalDate date) throws InvalidAmountException, DeptPaymentFailedException, PaymentIsGreaterThanRemaining
        Adds and saves new payment for a debt specified in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        debt - the debt that will be payed
        amountString - the string representation of the amount of the payment
        date - date of the payment
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException - if the amount can't be parsed to a double or the amount is 0 or less
        DeptPaymentFailedException - if an IO Error occured during the process
        PaymentIsGreaterThanRemaining - if the payed amount is greater than the remaining (the remaining amount will be payed)

      • payAll

        public void payAll(Debt debt, LocalDate date) throws DeptPaymentFailedException
        Pays the full remaining amount for the debt
        Parameters:
        debt - the debt which will be payed
        date - date of payment
        Throws:
        DeptPaymentFailedException - if an IO Error occured

      • filterFor

        public void filterFor(DebtController.DebtDirection direction, DebtController.DebtFulfilled fulfilled, String userName) throws UserNotFound, UpdatingModelFailed
        Filters for a specified direction, user and fulfilled state. Then updates the DebtListModel according to the filters.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction of debt *
        • I_OWE - show only those where the user singed in is the debtor
        • THEY_OWE - show only those where the user signed in is the creditor
        • UNSET - show all
        fulfilled -
        • ALL - show all
        • FULFILLED - show only those where the debt is fulfilled
        • NOT_FULFILLED - show only those where the debt is not fulfilled
        userName - the name of the user that is either the debtor or the creditor. If left empty then the function wont filter for username.
        Throws:
        UserNotFound - if the user with the specified name was not found
        UpdatingModelFailed - if updateing the model failed due to an IO Error

      • updateDebtListModel

        private void updateDebtListModel(DebtController.DebtDirection direction, DebtController.DebtFulfilled fulfilled, User user) throws UpdatingModelFailed
        Updates the DebtListModel based on a specifeid debt direction, a user and a fulfilled state
        Parameters:
        direction -
        • UNSET - model will not fitler for direction type
        • I_OWE - model will only contain records where the user signed in is the debtor
        • THEY_OWE - model will only contain records where the user signed in is the creditor
        fulfilled -
        • ALL - model will not fitler for fulfilled state
        • FULFILLED - model will only contain records where the debt is fulfilled
        • NOT_FULFILLED- model will only contain records where the debt is not fulfilled
        user - model will only contain records where the user is either the debtor or the creditor. If set to null then the model will not be filtered for a user.
        Throws:
        UpdatingModelFailed - if updateing the model failed due to an IO Error

      • pay

        private void pay(Debt debt, double amount, LocalDate date) throws DeptPaymentFailedException
        Payes a specified amount to a debt.
        Parameters:
        debt - the debt which will be payed
        amount - the amount that will be added to the debt's payment
        date - the date of the payment
        Throws:
        DeptPaymentFailedException - if the payment failed due to an IO Error

      • calculateDebtor

        private User calculateDebtor(User counterParty, DebtController.DebtDirection direction) throws UnknownDebtDirection
        Calculates and returns the debtor (User) between a given user and the user signed in based on the debt direction
        Parameters:
        counterParty - the other user
        direction - the direction of the payment
        Returns:
        the user that should be the debtor
        Throws:
        UnknownDebtDirection - if the direction is not set to I_OWE or THEY_OWE

      • calculateCreditor

        private User calculateCreditor(User counterParty, DebtController.DebtDirection direction) throws UnknownDebtDirection
        Calculates and returns the creditor (User) between a given user and the user signed in based on the debt direction
        Parameters:
        counterParty - the other user
        direction - the direction of the payment
        Returns:
        the user that should be the creditor
        Throws:
        UnknownDebtDirection - if the direction is not set to I_OWE or THEY_OWE

      • getDirection

        public DebtController.DebtDirection getDirection(Debt debt)
        Returns the direction of a debt based on the current user signed in
        Parameters:
        debt -
        Returns:
        • I_OWE - if the user signed in is the debtor
        • THEY_OWE - if the user signed in is the creditor

      • validateAmount

        private void validateAmount(double amount, Debt debt) throws InvalidAmountException
        Checks if the amount is valid. Throws exception if not.

        Amount must be greater than 0 and greater than the repayed amount of the debt if it was not set to null

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount that will be checked
        debt - the debt to compare with (can be setto null)
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException - if one of the checks fail

        public List<Debt> getAllDebts() throws SerializerCannotRead
        Throws:
        SerializerCannotRead
